Ref Table(s).103: WELLWELL_TEST_PRESSUREWELL_LOGWELL_TEST_FLOWWELL_LOG_DGTZ_CURVEWELL_LICENSEWELL_LOG_CURVESTRAT_WELL_SECTIONWELL_ACTIVITYWELL_DRILL_REPORTPROD_STRING

Column Comment.0: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.1: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.2: CONTENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique number for the description of contentassociated with the information item.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: ACTIVITY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number uniquely identifying each observationof an activity.
Column Comment.5: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.6: APPLICATION ID: Unique identifier for applications you make for continuations,licenses etc. to the government.
Column Comment.7: APPLICATION ATTACHMENT IDENTFIER: unique identifer for an applicationattachment.
Column Comment.8: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.9: AREA TYPE ID: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.10: BA AUTHORITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the row that describes theauthority that a business associaate has over business objects.
Column Comment.11: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE LICENSE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: unique identifier for abusiness associate who has been granted approval or a license to conductoperations.
Column Comment.12: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE LICENSE ID: Unique identifier for a license granted to abusiness associate.
Column Comment.13: BIN_GRID_ID: Unique identifier for the bin grid
Column Comment.14: BIN_GRID_SOURCE: The source of the bin grid data
Column Comment.15: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.16: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual peices ofequipment that exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT.
Column Comment.17: COLUMN NAME: the name of a column in a database schema.
Column Comment.18: CONSENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the consent. Consents grantpermission to conduct operations based on approval of what is done or proposed byanother. Conditions, including actions to be taken or fees to be paid, may or may notbe applied against the consent
Column Comment.19: CONSULTATION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this consultation as it pertains toan activity or request for an activity. Consultation discussions may occur at any pointin the life cycle of a business object.
Column Comment.20: RM INFORMATION ITEM CONTENT TYPE: The type of content associated with arecords management information item
Column Comment.21: CONTEST ID: Unique identifier to track a contestment between companies,countries, states and other jurisdictional bodies.
Column Comment.22: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.23: DISCUSSION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for each discussion held during theconsultation.
Column Comment.24: DRILLING REPORT IDENTIFIER: Use with UWI column. Identifies a well operationsdrilling report.
Column Comment.25: ECOZONE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sedimentary rock unit or environmentin which fossil deposition occurs. Often, these ecozones are marine or fresh water.Marine ecozones include the category of marine benthic zones, namely shelf, slope,and abyssal zones. The ecozone is defined by the organisms that are found in it.
Column Comment.26: ECOZONE SET IDENTIFER: unique identifier for the set of ecozone definitionsgathered together into a single set that is used for common reference in analysis. Aset definition may belong to a regulatory agency (USGS or MMS) or to asurveyorganization (AGSO) or to a data vendor.
Column Comment.27: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.28: ENTITLEMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the row in the entitlement table.
Column Comment.29: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.30: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.31: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.32: FACILITY LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a facility license or approval.
Column Comment.33: FACILITY TYPE: A reference table identifying the codes classifying the facilityaccording to its physical equipment or principal service performed. Please note thatFACILITY_TYPE will eventually become a SUBTYPE and downsized to 30characters.
Column Comment.34: FIELD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the field.
Column Comment.35: FINANCE SUIMMARY IDENTIFIER: Summary information about a financialreference, such as an AFE for an activity, such as seismic acquisition or processing.Could be a cost center or any other reference number.
Column Comment.36: FOSSIL DESCRIPTION IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for the fossil description
Column Comment.37: FOSSIL IDENTIFIER: Unique Identifier for a fossil.
Column Comment.38: INCIDENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an health safety or environment relatedincident.
Column Comment.39: INSTRUMENT ID: Unique identifier for the instrument.
Column Comment.40: INTEREST SET IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the interest set.
Column Comment.41: INTEREST SET SEQUENCE NUMBER: unique sequencing component to allowverioning of the interest set over time.
Column Comment.42: INTERPRETATION IDENTIFIER: added to enable a single strat unit to be identifiedmore than once as part of a stratigraphic column. Multiple occurances may occur formany reasons, including folding, faulting or a non-vertical interpretation of the stratcolumn.
Column Comment.43: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.44: LAND REQUEST ID: Unique identifier for the land request.
Column Comment.45: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.46: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: column indicating the type of land right. Must be one of thevalid subtypes: LAND TITLE, LAND LEASE, LAND GRANTED RIGHT, LAND UNIT,LAND UNIT TRACT, LAND AGREEMENT, LAND AGREE PART.
Column Comment.47: LAND SALE NUMBER: A unique identifier for the land sale
Column Comment.48: LAND SALE OFFERING ID: Unique identifier for the land sale offering.
Column Comment.49: LITHOLOGY LOG ID: A unique identifier for a descriptive record of lithology.
Column Comment.50: LITH LOG SOURCE: The source of data for this lithologic log.
Column Comment.51: LITHOLOGIC SAMPLE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a lithologic sample, such asrock cutting, mud sample, core etc.
Column Comment.52: NOTIFICATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the notification.
Column Comment.53: OBLIGATION ID: Unique identifier for each obligation
Column Comment.54: OBLIGATION SEQ NO: Unique identifier for each part or occurrence of an obligation
Column Comment.55: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for anorganization of a company or organization.
Column Comment.56: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for anorganization of a company or organization.
Column Comment.57: PALEO SUMMARY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the paleo summary report thatis captured.
Column Comment.58: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.59: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.60: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.61: CUSTODY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this row of data in the chain of custodytable.
Column Comment.62: PHYSICAL ITEM ID: The unique identifier for the physical item.
Column Comment.63: PLATFORM IDENTIFIER: Unique number assigned to the offshore drilling platformor onshore drilling pad..
Column Comment.64: PLATFORM SF SUBTYPE: part of the FK from SF PLATFORM.
Column Comment.65: POOL IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying the pool.
Column Comment.66: AUDIT ROW GUID: The GUID of the row for which audit information has beencaptured.
Column Comment.67: AUDIT SEQUENCE NUMBER: a number that is used to order the occurence ofauditable changes to values in the database.
Column Comment.68: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.69: PRODUCT_TYPE: The product identified as a component for this table.
Column Comment.70: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.71: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.72: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project.
Column Comment.73: PROJECT STEP IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a step in a project. Can be usedto facilitate work flow management, to indicate documents or other products that areused for a specific step in a project.
Column Comment.74: RATE and FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided.
Column Comment.75: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.76: RESERVES ENTITY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a reserves entity.
Column Comment.77: RESERVE CLASS IDENTIFIER: The reserve classed for identifying the confidencelevel and producing status of the reserve volumes.
Column Comment.78: RESERVE CLASS IDENTIFIER: The reserve classed for identifying the confidencelevel and producing status of the reserve volumes.
Column Comment.79: REVISION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the reserves estimate revision.
Column Comment.80: REVISION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique numeric component to connect allrevisions (net and gross) associated with a single revision occurrence. REVISION IDis used to group the revision event and REVISION OBS NO is set back to 1 eachtime a new revision event is created.
Column Comment.81: SUMMARY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the reserves summary.
Column Comment.82: SUMMARY OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique number added to allow details for areserves summary to be captured. The column SUMMARY ID defines a summary -SUMMARY OBS NO is used to sequence detail rows within that summary.
Column Comment.83: RESTRICTION ID: unique identifier for the restriction.
Column Comment.84: RESTRICTION VERSION: allows the restriction to be versioned over time. Variouslands may be subject to different version of the restriction.
Column Comment.85: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.86: SEISMIC LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a license for seismic or othergeophysical operations, normally granted against a SEIS PLAN, but eventually to realfield seismic data.
Column Comment.87: SEISMIC PATCH: capture generalized recording patch designs. Details about thepatch design are contained in the table SEIS_PATCH_DESC or can be desribed in adigital file that is stored in the RM module.
Column Comment.88: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets are SEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.89: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries may be SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.90: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.91: SOURCE DOCUMENT: A list of documents that are used as the source for supplyingdata. Source documents may include government and regulatory forms, operatorreports or scout tickets, publications, news letters, books or jounals.
Column Comment.92: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of land. Thesurface description may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes andbounds or polygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals(substances) and subsurface definition (zones/formations) to which rights aregranted. For land rights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatialdescription.
Column Comment.93: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.94: STRATIGRAPHIC COLUMN IDENTIFIER: The ID assigned to the stratigraphiccolumn.
Column Comment.95: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.96: STRATIGRAPHIC FIELD STATION IDENTIFIER: Part of the foreign key fromSTRAT FIELD STATION in this table.
Column Comment.97: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.98: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.99: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on.Sub tyes are used tomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.100: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.101: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.102: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within a schema. In this table, this is usually areference to the table name that the populated or used foreign key references. Eachrow in this table should reference one foreign key (most of the time).
Column Comment.103: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.104: VELOCITY VOLUME IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for this velocity volume.
Column Comment.105: WELL CORE IDENTIFIER : Unique identifier assigned to each physical core within aborehole.
Column Comment.106: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.107: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.108: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.109: DIRECTIONAL SURVEY IDENTIFIER: Number uniquely identifying each directionalsurvey.
Column Comment.110: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.111: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.112: WELL LICENSE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the wel license.
Column Comment.113: WELL LICENSE SOURCE: the source of the well license document.
Column Comment.114: CURVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to the curve or trace.
Column Comment.115: WELL LOG ID: Unique identifier for the well log.
Column Comment.116: WELL LOG SOURCE: The source of this well log data.
Column Comment.117: DIGITAL CURVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the digital log curve interval.
Column Comment.118: WORK ORDER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the work order.
Column Comment.119: WELL TEST FLOW FLUID TYPE: The type of fluid measured during the well test.
Column Comment.120: WELL TEST PERIOD OBS NO: A unique identifier for each observation in the welltest flow
Column Comment.121: WELL TEST PERIOD TYPE: A reference table identifying the length of time for whicha volume is recorded. Possible values are DAY, MONTH, YEAR.
Column Comment.122: WELL TEST RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip intothe well for the purpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.123: WELL TEST SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agencydesignated as the source of information for this data
Column Comment.124: WELL TEST TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual testoccurring within a test run or trip.
Column Comment.125: WELL TEST TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test usedto evaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.126: WELL TEST PERIOD OBS NO: A unique identifier for each observation in the welltest flow
Column Comment.127: WELL TEST PERIOD TYPE: A reference table identifying the length of time for whicha volume is recorded. Possible values are DAY, MONTH, YEAR.
Column Comment.128: WELL TEST RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip intothe well for the purpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.129: WELL TEST SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agencydesignated as the source of information for this data
Column Comment.130: WELL TEST TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual testoccurring within a test run or trip.
Column Comment.131: WELL TEST TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test usedto evaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.132: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.133: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.134: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.135: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.136: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.137: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.138: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
